title: iPHIS Resources | Public Health Ontario
description: Resources to support public health units in completing reporting and surveillance of DOPHS in Ontario, including iPHIS User Guides, Quick Reference Documents and Bulletins.
cleaned_text: Public Health Information System (iPHIS) is an information system for the reporting and surveillance of Diseases of Public Health Significance (DOPHS) in Ontario. This page contains resources that support public health units in completing these activities, including: user guides, which specify provincial data entry requirements and guidelines by disease, disease group or topic; supplementary quick reference documents; and bulletins, which establish common operational policies, procedures and data standards. iPHIS User Guides iPHIS Quick Reference Documents iPHIS Bulletins PHO Rounds: Characteristics of Substance-Related Toxicity Deaths in Ontario Speakers will present the findings of the report outlining the evolving trends and contextual factors surrounding fatal instances of substance-related toxicities across Ontario, combining data related to fatalities stemming from alcohol, stimulants, benzodiazepines and opioids.
